alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montezuma County through 415 PM MDT... At 349 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dolores, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cortez. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 31. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 35 and 55. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 6, and between mile markers 14 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
